item.title: Flintlock: The Siege Of Dawn - How To Get The Warlock’s Armor Set
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get The Warlock's Helmet In Flintlock: The Siege Of Dawn
  • Where To Get The Warlock's Gauntlet In Flintlock: The Siege Of Dawn
  • Where To Get The Warlock's Pauldron In Flintlock: The Siege Of Dawn

Flintlock: The Siege Of Dawn will have Nor accompanied by the lesser god known as Enki, who not only acts as a guide but also another option to use in combat. While there are various cursed stones to equip on Enki, all of his attacks curse your enemies in one way or another.

The Warlock set takes advantage of these curses and is best for players who level up Enki's skill tree and also use his attacks often. While the first armor piece is found fairly early on, you'll need to progress through the main story and travel to the second region of the game before you can get the other armor pieces and use the Armor Synergy Bonus.

Where To Get The Warlock's Helmet In Flintlock: The Siege Of Dawn

  • When you apply four curses in ten seconds, an explosion will trigger and deal 40 damage to all enemies 4 meters away.

The Warlock's helmet is found when players first reach the Foglands in Three Peaks. When entering the Foglands, you'll reach an area with a destroyed bridge where you'll need to drop down on or shoot an enemy to proceed. While the correct way forward is by going right, instead head left through a small valley to reach a clearing with a few enemies and a chest beneath a tent , with the Warlock's Helmet in the chest.

Where To Get The Warlock's Gauntlet In Flintlock: The Siege Of Dawn

  • All curses last 50% longer.

The Warlock's Gauntlet is a reward during the Tempered Bonds Sapper quest in the second region of the game, Wanderer's Rest. After receiving the request from Jung, you'll head to the location in Sunshelter where you'll come face-to-face with an armored knight wielding a two-handed sword. Defeating this enemy won't complete the quest, but will reward the player with the Warlock's Gauntlet.

Where To Get The Warlock's Pauldron In Flintlock: The Siege Of Dawn

  • Enemies inflicted with curse take two damage every second.

The Warlock's Pauldron is the reward for completing The Family Condition Sapper quest in Wanderer's Rest, the second region of the game. You'll first need to complete the Sapper's Quest In Safe Hands given by Luca, which rewards a useful firearm before this quest can be completed. Purchase any skills and upgrade your weapons before proceeding with this quest as it will take you to a different region only meant for this quest, with a boss fight at the end.

The Armor Synergy Bonus for this armor set transfers all curses from a killed enemy onto another enemy with 10 meters . This is great for those trying to constantly use Enki's curses but is being held back by how many times he can attack before recharging. Those who don't use Enki often will find little effect from this armor set, and should instead focus on a more straightforward option like the Sapper's Set.

item.title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn Cements Xbox Game Pass as the Home of Soulslikes
item.description:
Highlights

  • Xbox Game Pass offers 510 games on Ultimate tier, with 473 on PC Game Pass alone, covering various genres.
  • The continuously adds new titles monthly, guaranteeing a wide variety of gaming experiences for fans. Soulslike fans in particular have a lot to enjoy.
  • Xbox Game Pass has a special affinity for Soulslike games, with recent addition, Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn, proving as much. Other standout soulslikes include Another Crab's Treasure, Wo Long, and Lies of P.

According to Microsoft's official website, Xbox Game Pass currently has 510 games on offer via its Ultimate tier, with 473 games being available on PC Game Pass alone. Of those 510, gamers are sure to find at least a handful of games from every conceivable genre, from action to strategy to simulation and everything in between. And that handful is sure to run the gamut of first-party, third-party, and Indie releases.

Variety is Xbox Game Pass' whole deal, and it's something that's remained a vital component of the service since its launch in 2017. With every batch of new titles that hits Game Pass every month, fans are guaranteed to find a wide variety of genres and experiences. This month alone, Xbox Game Pass has added sports games, platform fighters, action-strategies, and open-world action-adventures. But while Xbox Game Pass is home to all types of video game experiences, there's one genre it seems to have a particular penchant for, and the recent addition of Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn seems to cement that feeling.

Xbox Game Pass Is a Hub for Soulslikes

With the release of Demon's Souls in 2009 and Dark Souls in 2011, a new type of action-adventure game was released into the world. A compelling blend of methodical, slower-paced combat, brutal challenge, and light RPG elements formed the basis of what would go on to be known as the Soulslike genre, a genre that's continued to grow exponentially more popular over the last decade or so. And as the Soulslike genre has continued to grow, Xbox Game Pass has continued to grow right alongside it.

For years now, Soulslike games have thrived on Xbox Game Pass, and they've been a consistent part of the service's monthly line-up. These Soulslikes have ranged from huge AAA entries like Star Wars Jedi: Survivor , to Indie games like Death's Door , and a whole swathe in between. Many of these additions have also been day-one launches on the service, with well-known games like Another Crab's Treasure , Lies of P , and Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty all being soulslikes that hit Xbox Game Pass on release day.

The Soulslike genre is, rather famously, quite difficult for newcomers to get into. A higher level of difficulty, a greater reliance on skill-based combat, and some more obtuse gameplay mechanics and narrative devices can leave Soulslike newcomers feeling a bit overwhelmed. But this is where Xbox Game Pass' close relationship with the Soulslike genre becomes mutually beneficial for both parties. Xbox Game Pass allows Soulslike newcomers to dip their toes into the often intimidating genre for no extra cost, and that gives the game a better chance of succeeding and gives Xbox Game Pass more titles to add to its ever-growing service.

Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn Continues Game Pass' Soulslike Trend

Released just a few days ago, Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn is the latest entry in Xbox Game Pass' Soulslike strategy. Much like titles such as Lies of P and Another Crab's Treasure before it, Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn is an ambitious smaller-scale Soulslike that may not be perfect but has a lot of innovative ideas and is certainly worth checking out for fans of the genre, making it the perfect Xbox Game Pass addition. And just like past Soulslikes, Flintlock 's place on Xbox Game Pass is sure to bring more players on board while also adding another solid game to the service, marking another win-win scenario.

item.title: Persona 3 Reload: Calendar Guide & Walkthrough (What You Should Do Everyday)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • General Notes For P3R Calendar
  • Daily Availability Of Social Links And Social Stat Raising Activities In P3 Reload
  • What You Should Do Everyday In Persona 3 Reload

Many players use calendar guides to figure out what to do every day for RPGs, and that extends to Persona 3 Reload . Having a guide helps players unlock and max out every Social Link on their first playthrough or efficiently increase social stats. Planning out a calendar can also help players conserve time and resources for Tartarus expeditions.

Players may prefer to have a loose schedule to adjust for role-playing purposes. Others may go all out and arrange a strict schedule to unlock and max out Social Links at the earliest time. Either way, having a calendar guide for P3 Reload can minimize frustration over missed opportunities and deadlines.

To search for a particular day, hit CTRL+F and type a date (e.g., 5/23).

Updated on July 20, 2024 by Rie Takumi: January is crucial for players with still unranked Social Links. Plan the calendar wisely as some unexpected holidays might steal away critical days for social link level ups. Always remember to equip the right Persona to boost interactions with Social Link contacts. As for Tartarus, saving up money to create the best fusions for Nyx, and for hardcore players the Reaper and Elizabeth, is the best way to go.

General Notes For P3R Calendar

  • Always have a corresponding Persona . Having a Persona that matches the Arcana of any Social Link the player interacts with gives interactions a points boost.
  • The school nurse, Mr. Edogawa, will only offer medicine on days after exploring Tartarus. Drinking his medicine grants +2 Courage . Visiting the clinic won’t take up the entire After School period, so going to Mr. Edogawa after Tartarus days is encouraged.
  • Unlike previous games, P3R doesn’t allow players to select their clubs. These are the only clubs available to the player:
    • Track Team – Unlocks Chariot and Strength Social Links
    • Art Club – Unlocks Fortune Social Link
    • Home Economics Club – Unlocks Temperance Social Link
    • Student Council – Unlocks Emperor and Justice Social Links

  • On the flip side, returning to the dorm on days off no longer progresses time.
  • P3 Reload also shows what other players with network functions do daily. Players who have no plans can consult this to get an idea of how to plan their day.
  • There are three playable exam weeks in total. Passing exams requires a certain Academics rank and another rank beyond that to come in first.
  • Persona 3 Reload ’s exam periods are:
    • 1st Midterms: May 18 to 23 - Requires Academics Rank 3 to rank 1st
    • 1st Finals: July 14 to 18 - Requires Academics Rank 5 to rank 1st
    • 2nd Midterms: September 13 to 17 - Requires Academics Rank 6 to rank 1st

  • Becoming the top-notcher for at least one of these exams is required to unlock The Empress Social Link.

Daily Availability Of Social Links And Social Stat Raising Activities In P3 Reload

Half the fun of Persona 3 Reload is planning out daily activities. Social Links and most social stat-raising activities take up entire time periods. Some options, like Mr. Edogawa’s strange brew, pass in a blip and allow players to stack actions.

The guide below breaks down each activity, the number of points they give, and how many points are needed to rank up social stats.

The tables below are a day-by-day breakdown of movies, arcade games, social stat-raising locations, and Social Links. Note that school-only Social Links, save for the Empress and the Moon, are not available the week before exams :

What You Should Do Everyday In Persona 3 Reload

4/8–20 | April 8–20, 2009 | Tuesday

  • P3R eases players into its RPG system during this period. Players can move around, explore most of the map, and scope out what activities are available to them. Free actions, however, are not unlocked until the 21st.
  • The Fool , the player's first social link, will automatically level up on certain dates . Players will be at Fool Rank 2 at the end of this period.
  • During this period, P3 Reload gives players opportunities to raise their Charm and Academics. Players can answer questions in class for Charm and stay awake for Academics.
  • Answering questions correctly and staying awake through all four chances can net players +4 Charm and +4 Academics .
  • Courage is the easiest to max out, followed by Charm. Academics takes the most points to reach Rank 6.

4/21 | April 21, 2009 | Tuesday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • This is the first full day players have for raising stats and improving social links.
  • Ideally, players should aim to rank their Academics up for midterms next month.
  • However, players should also consider ranking their Courage up . Some Social Links that will be made available as early as May and June require Courage Rank 2, 4, and 6.
  • Players can split these priorities between the After School and Evening periods.
  • For 4/21, it’s recommended to:
    • Drink Mr. Edogawa’s medicine ( +2 Courage )
    • Offer ¥1,000 at Naganaki Shrine ( +3 Academics )
    • Play at the arcade ( +4 Courage )

  • Twilight Fragments, the item players pick up during a cutscene, are scattered around the map. Every location on the fast travel menu has a Twilight Fragment. Collecting these won’t take time and will allow players to open locked boxes and use the restoration clock in Tartarus .
  • While the urge to buy equipment and supplies is tempting, players should hold off for now. All combat-related shops have sale days that drastically reduce prices.

4/22 | April 22, 2009 | Wednesday

  • Kenji Tomochika blocks off the After School period. His Social Link , the Magician , is the first optional Social Link the player unlocks (Magician Rank 1) .
  • Players must hang out with Social Links to rank them up. By doing so, Personas under that Social Link’s arcana will receive a boost when fusing them.
  • Reaching Rank 10 on a Social Link also unlocks an exclusive Persona that can’t be obtained through other means.
  • To maximize each Social Link interaction, players should have a Persona of the same arcana. As an example, players should have a Magician-type Persona on their roster when hanging out with Kenji to get more rank-up points.
  • Social Links can now email the player for hang-outs. Businesses that the player visited at least once will also begin sending promotional emails. These emails act as fast travel points and accepting them will not automatically lock in time.
  • During the Evening, players should play at the arcade ( +4 Academics ).

4/23 | April 23, 2009 | Thursday

[Thursday schedule]

  • The track team is recruiting members. Joining the track team will unlock the Chariot and Strength Social Link . However, players must ask Yuko Nishiwaki to walk home after the Rank 1 and 2 events of the Chariot to unlock the Strength.
  • Naganaki Shrine now offers relationship fortunes. For ¥100 and the entire After School period, players can improve their relationship with any Social Link . This works regardless of their availability on that day.
  • Fortunes can also give or take away player funds. For example, “fair luck” gives players ¥1,000.
  • Today, unlock the Chariot Social Link ( Chariot Rank 1 ) and try to invite Yuko to walk home .
  • Players will likely run low on funds by today or Friday. It’s recommended to go on a Tartarus run on either day. For this guide, it’s recommended to go today .
  • Depending on their run, players can potentially earn ¥10,000 to ¥40,000 on Shuffle Luck chances and sellable loot in Tartarus today.
  • Floor 12 has a tutorial Wealth Hand that gives a ton of gold and exp. There may also be floors with at least three Wealth Hands at random.
  • It’s highly recommended to level up enough to fuse the following personas:
    • Nekomata (Magician, Rank 5)
    • Ara Mitama (Chariot, Rank 6)
    • Omoikane (Hierophant, Rank 7)
    • Valkyrie (Strength, Rank 11)
    • Forneus (Emperor, Rank 7)
    • Angel (Justice, Rank 4)

  • These Personas match the arcana of Social Links the player may unlock within April. Having a matching Persona boosts Social Link interactions and makes ranking up easier .
  • Mitsuru’s combat tutorials will appear until floor 21. For convenience, players can climb Tartarus up to floor 22 to finish the tutorial floors. Reaching that floor will also clear the first block of Tartarus .
  • Ideally, players should have Zio, stat-raising –ja skills, and stat lowering –nda skills. These will help with the first boss .
  • Since the first boss will appear on May 9 , clearing up to floor 22 will free all evenings until then. P3R ’s Shuffle Time mechanic also makes it easy to reach Lv. 12 without much grinding, which should help during the boss fight.

4/24 | April 24, 2009 | Friday

[Friday schedule]

  • Visit Mr. Edogawa for his special medicine ( +2 Courage ).
  • This is the earliest day players can unlock the Strength Social Link (Strength Rank 1) .
  • At night, going to Game Parade ( +4 Courage ) is recommended.

4/25 | April 25, 2009 | Saturday

[Saturday schedule]

  • The bookstore at Iwatodai Strip Mall re-opens today. Players unlock the Hierophant Social Link ( Hierophant Rank 1 ) by chatting with bookstore owners Bunkichi and Mitsuko. To unlock it:
  • Aohige Pharmacy holds its sale days on Saturday . This cuts down prices for HP and status recovery items.
  • Players should consider buying the following to prepare for Social Link unlocks and requests :
    • Super Cat Food and Muscle Drink from Aohige Pharmacy (Saturday for discounted prices)
    • Takoyaki from Iwatodai Strip Mall
    • One of each drink from vending machines at Port Island Station, Iwatodai Strip Mall, Iwatodai Station, and Iwatodai Dorm
    • An extra Mad Bull from the Iwatodai Dorm’s 2nd-floor vending machine

  • Playing at Game Parade is recommended ( +4 Academics ).
  • Umiushi Beef Bowls are exclusive and require a special unlock. Umiushi memberships are available on Wednesday, 4/29 .

4/26 | April 26, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • Social Links will invite players out during the Early Morning period. School Social Links, save for Nozomi, will only rank up during hang-outs. Accept Sunday and holiday hang-outs if the game says the Social Link will not advance yet .
  • The same rule applies for hang-outs during the Social Links' schedule that won't advance the rank.
  • Players should beware that saying yes to an invitation automatically blocks off the afternoon of that day. Luckily, players can delay responding to texts. As long as they respond within the daytime, players can pick which invitation to accept or to ignore all of them completely.
  • If players want to redo a decision, players can go back to their old saves or use the Rewind function .
  • Visit the old couple again ( Hierophant Rank 2 ).
  • If players follow recommendations, eating at Wilduck Burger ( +3 Courage ) today will rank up Courage to Rank 2, Ordinary .

4/27 | April 27, 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • Ms. Miyahara will ask a question today. Answering correctly gives +2 Charm .
  • Officer Kurosawa gives discounts on Mondays . It should be noted that Tartarus has better weapons and armor than what’s currently available here.
  • Elizabeth will give the players 5 Twilight Fragments upon visiting the Velvet Room if they rank up a social stat.
  • Mitsuru blocks off the After School period to initiate the player into the Student Council. This unlocks Hidetoshi Odagiri (Emperor Rank 1) , and later on, the Justice Social Link (Chihiro Fushimi) .
    • Players must first go to Ms. Toriumi at the faculty office.
    • After signing, head for the student council room across from the player’s classroom.

  • Reaching Courage Rank 2 gives players access to the fortune teller service at Club Escapade
  • Elizabeth will start making requests on 5/10 . While completely optional, some rewards are worth the effort.
  • Quite a few of Elizabeth’s requests can only be completed if players talk to the informant at Club Escapade. Buying URLs from the informant from 4/29 onwards unlocks items or functions needed for these requests. The first two URLs unlock:
    • Purchasable sold-out drinks at the Iwatodai Station - Required for Elizabeth’s request on 5/10
    • Lukewarm Taiyaki – Required for Elizabeth’s request on 7/9

  • Lastly, the Luxury Shopkeeper sells expensive accessories that can protect from all status ailments, grants more EXP, and even revives upon death.
  • To unlock The Moon , players should rank up their Charm. Grab a bowl of ramen at Hagakure ( +3 Charm ) to get started.

4/28 | April 28, 2009 | Tuesday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • Mitsuru tells the player that they cannot go on a Tartarus expedition if she’s not in the dorm .
  • Head out of the classroom and talk to Chihiro next to the student council room. Chihiro will be anxious, so players need to talk to her a second time later.
  • Hang out with Kenji ( Magician Rank 2 ). You need Rank 3 in his Social Link to discover the Moon Social Link .
  • Mitsuru informs the player that the dorm’s Internet line will be repaired tomorrow.
  • Junpei gives the player a copy of Innocent Sin Online. Aside from being a neat nod to Persona 1 and 2 , this MMORPG also unlocks the Hermit Social Link .
  • Eat at Hagakure Ramen ( +3 Charm ). The shop will inform players that a special menu item is available on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. It can be unlocked at Courage Lv. 3, Determined .

4/29 | April 29, 2009 | Wednesday

[Wednesday Schedule]

  • Today is a holiday (Showa Day), so all day-off activities are available. Tartarus is also unavailable .
  • Iwatodai Dorm’s internet is restored today. Players can unlock Umiushi membership using the dorm PC .
  • Play Innocent Sin Online to unlock the Hermit Social Link (Hermit Rank 1) . This Social Link is only accessible on Sundays and days off.
  • The Special Hagakure Bowl is listed on Hagakure’s menu, but players can’t buy it until they reach Courage Rank 3, Determined . For now, grab a pork ramen ( +3 Charm ) to rank up your Charm to Rank 2, Unpolished .

[Thursday schedule]

  • Mr. Edogawa will give a lecture on magic. Staying up grants +2 Academics .
  • Talk to Chihiro outside the student council room again, then respond with “I’m a guy.”
  • Go back to the classroom and talk to Kenji to rank up (Magician Rank 3) . The Moon will not unlock automatically. Players will have to wait until 5/8 to set it in motion.
  • Order a Prodigy Platter at Wakatsu Kitchen ( +3 Academics ), which informs the player of the Seafood Full Course. This special dish is offered to regulars on Monday, Thursday, Friday, and Sunday nights. But to be recognized as a regular, players need to reach Charm Rank 3 (Confident) .
  • With this order, players will reach Academics Rank 2 (Average) .

[Friday schedule]

  • Akihiko blocks off the After School period.
  • Head for the arcade and play House of the Deceased ( +4 Courage )

5/2 |May 2, 2009 | Saturday

[Saturday schedule]

  • The player overhears Gekkoukan High students talking about Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities. Airing Sundays , the shopping program sells gifts for Social Links, equipment, Elizabeth's requests (7/19) , and expendables.
  • Step outside the classroom and talk to Chihiro again.
  • Head for the Home Economics classroom. Academics Rank 2 reveals that the fashion club meets Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Fridays .
  • Before players can join and unlock the Temperance Social Link (Bebe) , Hierophant must first reach Rank 3.
  • But for efficiency’s sake, hanging out with Yuko ( Strength Rank 2 ) is the top choice today. Reaching Rank 3 for Strength will reveal the Tower Social Link (Mutatsu) .
  • School Social Links can’t be leveled up in the next three days due to Golden Week (5/3–5/6).
  • Play You’re the Answer at the arcade ( +4 Academics ).
  • The Mysterious Boy warns the player of an ordeal one week from now , on Saturday, May 9. The full moon always signals a boss fight .

5/3 | May 3, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • Players can tune into Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities. Tanaka offers the Rose Bouquet set this week.
  • Rose Bouquet can be given during dates with female characters for extra Social Link points. The SP-healing chocolate is a bonus.
  • Buying this set is optional, as the player’s money can be saved for social stat-raising activities.
  • Say hi to Bunkichi and Mitsuko ( Hierophant Rank 3 ). Make sure a Hierophant Persona is in the party for the rank boost. Bebe will introduce himself and invite the player to join the home economics club .
  • Like Bunkichi and Mitsuko, go out for dinner, though opt for Wilduck Burger ( +3 Courage ) to get a headstart on future Social Links.

5/4 |May 4, 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • Visit the Velvet Room. Elizabeth will reward the player with 6 Twilight Fragments.
  • If the player doesn’t have a Hermit Persona, summon one to have a bonus when playing Innocent Sin Online with Maya ( Hermit Rank 2 ).
  • Grab another Wilduck Burger ( +3 Courage ) to end the night.

5/5 |May 5, 2009 | Tuesday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • Before hanging out with a social link, players should make preparations for the Hanged Man Social Link .
  • Afterward, hang out at the Shinagawa Dungeon with Maya ( Hermit Rank 3 ).
  • Tartarus is off-limits tonight as Mitsuru and Akihiko are still out.
  • Play House of the Deceased ( +4 Courage ) to end Golden Week.

5/6 |May 6, 2009 | Wednesday

[Wednesday schedule]

  • Ms. Ounushi will ask a question in the morning. Answer correctly for +2 Charm .
  • With adequate preparations, players can access the Hanged Man Social Link (Maiko Oohashi) today.
  • While players can’t spend time with Maiko yet, she will be at the shrine playground on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays .
  • Take the rail back to Gekkoukan High School and join Bebe at the Home Economics club to unlock the Temperance Social Link ( Temperance Rank 1 ).
  • Players should hold off from fusing Hanged Man and Temperance Personas for now. Sunday evening will be spent in Tartarus to top off funds and fuse new Personas.
  • Grab dinner at Wilduck Burger ( +3 Courage ) to rank up Courage to Determined (Rank 3) .

5/7 |May 7, 2009 | Thursday

[Thursday schedule]

  • By following the guide for unlocking Chihiro, players can unlock the Justice Social Link ( Justice Rank 1 ) today.
  • Get invested in visual novels today with High School of Youth ( +4 Charm ).

5/8 | May 8, 2009 | Friday

[Friday schedule]

  • Approach Kenji, who should be at Rank 3 by now. He tells the player of the “Gourmet King,” an infamous “foodie.”
  • Follow up on the rumors by approaching the student on the bench at Paulownia Mall with Courage Rank 2 . Unlock the Moon Social Link ( Moon Rank 1 ) by completing Nozomi's tasks.
  • Tomorrow is a Full Moon. Players cannot do anything all day save for the story-mandated battles. Purchase supplies needed for the minor and boss battles today.
  • Finish Friday off with House of the Deceased ( +4 Courage ).

5/9 | May 9, 2009 | Saturday

  • Today is a Full Moon . Every full moon blocks off the entire day, so plan accordingly.
  • The Priestess boss has no elemental or physical weakness and is immune to status effects. As such, stat-raising and stat-lowering –ja and –ka skills plus Rebellion work well.
  • The Fool ( S.E.E.S. Rank 3 ) will rank up today.

5/10 | May 10, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • As Hermit is only available on weekends and holidays, improving their social link today is the way ( Hermit Rank 4 ).
  • Maya will warn the player about a creeper hanging around Paulownia Mall. That creeper is President Tanaka, who will only notice the player if they are at Charm Rank 4. His Social Link, the Devil, also takes several weeks to unlock.
  • Elizabeth will make requests starting today. She may request items, experiences, Personas, combat-related feats, and dates. Completing these requests is optional, though some of her rewards are worth the effort.
  • She will also reward the player with 8 Twilight Fragments. A sum of ¥10,000 will also be rewarded if players have reached floor 22 and retrieved Old Document 1 in Tartarus as part of Request #2 .
  • Request #12 (Bring me pine resin) can be completed today. Fast travel back to Iwatodai Dorm and ask Yukari for some pine resin. Elizabeth will exchange the pine resin for a Toy Bow, a weapon for Yukari.
  • Request #13 (Bring me a handheld game console) can also be completed. Talk to Junpei at the dorm and he’ll hand over his old console. The reward for this quest is the male-exclusive Pixel Vest, an armor that gives +10 SP.
  • Even with Elizabeth’s rewards, players will still be in the red by now. Set out on a Tartarus expedition. Akihiko will return to the party after the finals, but gathering funds to spend until the next full moon is a top priority.
  • Buy a fortune from the Fortune Teller to boost rare Shadow rates.
  • Any major arcana bosses the players defeat will be added to Shuffle Time. Each arcana offers different buffs, such as boosted EXP and attack rates.
  • If they left Tartarus last time at levels 11 to 12, players can easily complete the first half of Arqa , the newly unlocked block. Always return to the lobby whenever there is an elevator, not a one-way teleporter, to save and regroup.
  • Twilight Fragments are precious resources that can be picked up in Tartarus. A good rule to have is to only use these for locked chests that require three fragments to get new equipment. Conserve fragments for the clock as well to comfortably finish Arqa’s first block.
  • Players will also likely fulfill the following requests by today due to natural progress and fusing Personas for Social Links:
    • Request #3, #15, #22 – Defeat 100, 200, and 300 Shadows
    • Request #4 – Treasure Hunting Milestone
    • Request #5 – Create a Persona that’s level 13 or above
    • Request #6 – Create a Persona with Kouha
    • Request #7 – Bring me a Juzumaru
    • Request #14 – Retrieve the second old document
    • Request #17 – Fusion Series #1: Emperor, Oberon
    • Requests #15 and #22 – Defeat 200 to 300 Shadows

  • At the end of the expedition, players will likely reach Level 18 to 20 by floor 43. They’ll also accumulate ¥20,000 to ¥80,000 from battles, Shuffle Time, Elizabeth’s rewards, and selling loot. Note that unlocking the Devil Social Link (President Tanaka) requires ¥40,000 and Charm Rank 4.
  • If they reached Level 20 , players can now carry up to 10 Personas.

5/11 |May 11, 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • Don’t forget to stop by the school clinic to drink Mr. Edogawa’s medicine ( +2 Courage ). The Afternoon lecture will also give +2 Academics if players stay awake.
  • School Social Links are unavailable from today until May 22 due to midterms. The Moon (Nozomi Suemitsu) , however, is available along with Social Links outside of school.
  • Play with Maiko to officially unlock the Hanged Man Social Link (Rank 1) .
  • Beginning today, the command room will occasionally have footage of the SEES team. Check in every now and then to see in-game cutscenes of the crew goofing around.
  • Grab a Mystery Burger at Wilduck Burger ( +3 Courage ).

5/12 |May 12, 2009 | Tuesday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • Junpei will invite the player to hang out after school. His invitation introduces Linked Episodes , a new mechanic .
  • While not mandatory, these give players a chance to get to know male SEES members better. It’s an alternative to the female protagonist-only Social Links from Persona 3 Portable , which are unavailable.
  • Hanging out with SEES members will also raise their stats permanently . Finishing a S.E.E.S. member’s Linked Episode questline also unlocks an exclusive Persona fusion .
  • If a S.E.E.S. member has two exclamation points above them, or if the icon appears on the town map , it’s likely a Linked Episode.
  • Players usually have a few days or weeks to complete Linked Episodes.
  • See what Kazushi is up to ( Chariot Rank 2 ).
  • Play House of the Deceased ( +4 Courage ) at Game Parade. Courage will rank up to Rank 4, Tough .

  • Prep for the exams with Junpei and Yukari ( +4 Academics ).

5/17 | May 17, 2009 | Sunday

  • Join the SEES group study session ( +5 Academics ). Academics will rank up (Rank 3, Above Average) .

Rescuing them before their hard deadline is a must, especially if they are a Social Link . If players fail to rescue them, their Social Link will freeze and can never be restarted for that run .

  • Stay by Chihiro’s side while she frets about her allowance and relates to a guy helplessly in love ( Justice Rank 6 ).

  • Give the fruit knife to Elizabeth and accept her request for oil . Aigis at the dorm will give said oil; ask her for the item and hand it over to Elizabeth to finish the quest .

  • Receive a letter from the kids the player and Yuko trained ( Strength Rank 10 ). By reaching Rank 10 and with the letter, players can now fuse Atvaka .

11/16 | November 16 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • Take a nap during Mr. Ekoda’s lecture ( +2 Courage ) or stay up ( +2 Academics ).
  • Hidetoshi realizes that systems of power only work for the people if leaders have their trust and do not dictate their decisions ( Emperor Rank 9 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

11/17-19 | November 17-19, 2009 | Tuesday to Thursday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • All of S.E.E.S. except for Koromaru and Ken will go to Kyoto for their school trip. Players can walk around the inn to talk to second and third year Social Links.
  • Visit the shop at the first floor of the inn (Hara) on November 17 to buy a souvenir for Ken. Any item, which can be used in Tartarus, can be given. Pick up a drink for the girl at the courtyard to forward Elizabeth’s request .
  • Mitsuru will find closure and new resolve. Penthesilea will evolve into Artemisia and grant Mitsuru Blade of Execution . Mitsuru’s second Theurgy will deal severe Almighty damage to a single enemy and inflict debuffs .
  • Make a promise with Ryoji in the evening of November 18 . This will execute Ryoji’s Linked Episode the next day. Ryoji’s linked episode grants +1 to the equipped Persona’s stats .
  • Players can experience Mitsuru’s execution along with the S.E.E.S. boys and Ryoji on day 3 if they fail the hot spring event.
  • To avoid execution, hide by the steam , sacrifice the rubber duck, and tell Junpei to follow the leader . Otherwise, let the boys get executed.

11/20 | November 20, 2009 | Friday

[Friday schedule]

  • The class will return to Tokyo from morning until afternoon .
  • Give Ken his souvenir. Any item from Kyoto will do.
  • Tonight is a free night .

11/21| November 21, 2009 | Saturday

[Saturday schedule]

  • Career Experience Week will take up Tuesday to Friday next week.
  • Stay up for Ms. Toriumi’s lecture ( +2 Academics ) or have a morning nap ( +2 Courage ).
  • Give a drink from Kyoto to the Friendly Student at the school courtyard to forward one of Elizabeth’s requests . Fork over ¥5,000 to get the Oden Juice as well.
  • Promise Maiko you’ll be friends forever ( Hanged Man Rank 9 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .
  • Takaya and Jun survived their fall and have come to collect Chidori from the hospital.

11/22 | November 22, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities will have a pretty good deal for Garnet and Opal for ¥49,800.
  • Akinari will ask to see your face so he can remember it until the end ( Sun Rank 9 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .
  • Chidori will attempt to end S.E.E.S., but her love for Junpei leads her to give her life to revive him after he almost died.
  • Junpei’s resolve to honor Chidori’s sacrifice leads Medea and Hermes to become one, giving birth to Trismagestus .

11/23 | November 23, 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • Today is Labor Thanksgiving Day . There is no school today .
  • Maiko makes the protagonist promise that they’ll get married when she grows up ( Hanged Man Rank 10 ). The bead ring she gives the player unlocks Attis .
  • Tonight is a free night .

11/24-27 | November 24 to 27, 2009 | Tuesday to Friday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • It’s Career Experience Week . This week is blocked off until the evening of November 27 .
  • Kenji and the player will be placed at Wilduck Burger together. Ryoji will swing by Wilduck on November 27 and express concern for Junpei.
  • The evening of November 27 is a free night .

11/28 | November 28, 2009 | Saturday

[Saturday schedule]

  • Elizabeth will call to inform the player of people who wandered into Tartarus.
  • Start the Empress Social Link by helping Mitsuru learn how to eat ramen at Hagakure Ramen ( Empress Rank 1 ).
  • Junpei receives Chidori’s sketchbook, including her loving portrait of him. His newfound resolves grants him Blaze of Life , a Theurgy that deals massive fire damage to an enemy that ignores resistances and fully restores his HP .
  • The team’s bond strengthens Fool to Rank 9 .
  • Use a Dating Site Note to put points towards the Empress Social Link .

11/29 | November 29, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities will offer Shoes of Bane and Infrared Goggles for ¥39,800.
  • Akinari finds meaning in simply existing with loved ones and peacefully ascends ( Sun Rank 10 ). The worn notebook he wrote his story on unlocks Asura .
  • Read a book with Mitsuru to advance her hangout requirements ( +2 Academics ).

11/30 | November 30, 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • Tell Mr. Ekoda that Genji compared Murasaki-no-Ue to the cherry blossom ( +2 Charm ).
  • Accompany Mitsuru to Wilduck for her first time with fastfood ( Empress Rank 2 ).
  • Makoto will arrive at the dorm just as Ryoji is leaving after a visit.
  • Aigis expresses her concern for Makoto’s wellbeing.
  • If players hung out with Junpei earlier in the month, Chidori will live . Mitsuru will receive a call indicating her status late at night.
  • Use a Dating Site Note to put points towards the Empress Social Link .

12/1 | December 1, 2009 | Tuesday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • Meet Ryoji at Gekkoukan’s music room and hear his final words. +1 to the equipped Persona’s stats . This counts as one of Ryoji’s Linked Episodes.
  • Claim all missing persons requests outside the police station. Go into Tartarus to rescue the missing people .

12/2 | December 2, 2009 | Wednesday

[Wednesday schedule]

  • Share takoyaki with Koromaru and a stray dog and feel Koro’s determination to end the Dark Hour. This counts as one of Koromaru’s Linked Episodes.
  • Use the Dating Site Note to boost the Empress Social Link.
  • P3R introduces a cutscene that illustrates the truth behind Ryoji and the protagonist’s backstory.
  • Ryoji will reveal his true identity as Death, the Appriser and herald to a great maternal being .

12/3 | December 3, 2009 | Thursday

[Thursday schedule]

  • The entire day is blocked off .
  • Ryoji expounds on Nyx, the mother of Shadows . Nyx will turn the world’s population into the Lost if she is allowed to descend in The Fall . Ryoji gives Makoto and S.E.E.S. until December 31 to decide humanity’s fate.
  • Use the Dating Site Note to boost the Empress Social Link.

12/4 | December 4, 2009 | Friday

[Friday schedule]

  • Have Bebe’s back in his plans ( Temperance Rank 6 ).
  • S.E.E.S. will give recaps on recent information if spoken to.
  • Use the Dating Site Note to boost the Empress Social Link.

12/5| December 5, 2009 | Saturday

[Saturday schedule]

  • Don’t forget to have matching Personas for every Social Link interaction.
  • Watch Mitsuru learn the pain of eating takoyaki ( Empress Rank 3 ).
  • Use the Dating Site Note to boost the Empress Social Link.

12/6 | December 6, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities offers delicious Hogyoku Apples and Hiranya Mandarin for ¥14,800.
  • Talk about Mamoru’s prospective scholarship over takoyaki ( Star Rank 4 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/7 | December 7, 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • Ms. Ounishi reminds players that exams start next Monday. Give the correct answer to the classroom question for +2 Charm .
  • Gekkoukan club activities and most Social Links will be unavailable . Some Social Links can be found around town this week.
  • Tell Mitsuru what you think about marriage ( Empress Rank 4 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/8 | December 8, 2009 | Tuesday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • Ask Mitsuru about her motorcycle after watching a movie ( Empress Rank 5 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/9 | December 9, 2009 | Wednesday

[Wednesday schedule]

  • Mr. Ekoda reminds the class about finals. Tell him what magic Himiko used for +2 Charm .
  • Surprise Mitsuru by promising to do something about her arranged marriage ( Empress Rank 6 ).
  • Help Ken with his homework while Koromaru fetches some energy drink for extra Academics points.

12/10| December 10, 2009 | Thursday

[Thursday schedule]

  • Elizabeth will call to tell the player about people wandering into Tartarus.
  • Promise to take Mitsuru out until her graduation ( Empress Rank 7 ).
  • Junpei lashes out at having to decide whether to doom humanity or fight a hopeless battle at the team meeting.
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/11 | December 11, 2009 | Friday

[Friday schedule]

  • Help Junpei with Ms. Toriumi's question for Charm points.
  • Witness Mitsuru snap back against the adult she’s put in an arranged marriage in ( Empress Rank 8 ).
  • Recover from Mitsuru running away to study with her and Akihiko for an Academics boost.

12/12| December 12, 2009 | Saturday

[Saturday schedule]

  • Stay up for Mr. Ono’s lecture for Academics or nap for Courage .
  • Reject or accept Mitsuru’s proposal. Either way, Mitsuru will apologize for last time, die a little inside as she confesses, and accepts the player’s decision ( Empress Rank 9 ).
  • The Social Link stars on the rank up screen will change to hearts if players accept any SL’s confession.
  • Cheer the second years up and study with Junpei, Fuuka, and Yukari for some Academics points.

12/13 | December 13, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • Score a Victory Headband and Mind Supplements for ¥29,800 if you want to from Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities.
  • Make a promise with Mamoru to eat donburi with him ( Star Rank 5 ).
  • Arrange one last group study session with S.E.E.S. and take Koromaru out for a walk ( Academics ).

12/14-18| December 14-18, 2009 | Monday to Friday

[Monday schedule]

  • Finals will take up Monday to Saturday morning .

12/19| December 19, 2009 | Saturday

[Saturday schedule]

  • Have Junpei treat you to takoyaki, hear his apology, and his encouragement to do as you see fit ( Courage ). This counts as one of Junpei’s Linked Episode.
  • Go jogging with Akihiko, beat down some thugs, and hear his conviction ( Stat ). This counts as one of Akihiko’s Linked Episode.

12/20 | December 20, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • Mitsuru and Yukari will talk about Makoto, life, and the battle with Nyx.
  • Players can grab a Pink Duffle Coat and Luxe Shiruko Can for ¥49,800 from Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities.
  • Mamoru is forced to cancel your plans after his mom fainted ( Star Rank 6 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/21 | December 21, 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • Get a good boost to stats for ranking first on the finals.
  • Nap during Mr. Takenozuka’s lecture ( Courage ) or pay attention ( Academics ).
  • Receive x4 Master Incense and a Phoenix Charm from Mitsuru then hang out with her.
  • Mitsuru will hand the player a copy of her motorcycle’s key and takes the player out on a short drive to the Millennium Bridge ( Empress Rank 10 ). The motorcycle key unlocks Alilat .
  • Read with Mitsuru and hear her muse about her father ( Academics ). Her new Characteristic, Ailment Surge , greatly raises her critical rate when attacking ailment-struck enemies.

12/22 | December 22, 2009 | Tuesday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • More people have wandered into Tartarus.
  • Answer the plot-relevant question from Mr. Edogawa for Charm points.
  • Encourage Bebe in his plans to sew a kimono ( Temperance Rank 7 ).
  • Watch a movie with Yukari ( Charm ). Healing Master reduces the SP cost of recovery skills to 50% of their normal SP cost .

12/23 | December 23, 2009 | Wednesday

[Wednesday schedule]

  • Today is a holiday.
  • Ken and Akihiko will talk about Ken’s mom, Miki, and Shinjiro, and the promises they’ve made to them.
  • Tell Mamoru to never give up on his track dreams ( Star Rank 7 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/24 | December 24, 2009 | Thursday

[Thursday schedule]

  • Stay up for Mrs. Terauchi’s holiday lecture ( Academics ) or snooze ( Courage ).
  • Players can spend time with any romanced female Social Link or choose to spend Christmas Eve alone. Every romanced Social Link will give the player a unique gift . If players choose to romance everyone, they will get beat up and a different gift.
  • For this guide, skip the date and help Keisuke think about what he really wants in the future ( Fortune Rank 7 ).

12/25 | December 25, 2009 | Friday

[Friday schedule]

  • Help Bebe make progress on his kimono and keep him motivated ( Temperance Rank 8 ).
  • Train on the rooftop with Ken and feel his determination to keep living. This counts as one of Ken’s Linked Episodes.

12/26| December 26, 2009 | Saturday

[Saturday schedule]

  • Have a snug nap in the morning ( Courage ) or hear out Ms. Toriumi ( Academics ).
  • Finish the Lovers Arcana ( Lovers Rank 10 ) and unlock Cybele for fusion.
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/27 | December 27, 2009 | Sunday

[Sunday schedule]

  • Fuuka finds Junpei with Chidori’s sketchpad, and they agree to fight together for the future.
  • If the player has cash to burn, buy Ruby and Opal for ¥99,000 from Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities.
  • Mamoru will cheerily tell the player about his mom getting out and team getting back in touch ( Star Rank 8 ).
  • Rate Ken’s newest brew to unlock Spirit Restore , which helps him automatically recover 10 SP each turn in battle .

12/28 | December 28, 2009 | Monday

[Monday schedule]

  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/29 | December 29, 2009 | Tuesday

[Tuesday schedule]

  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Tonight is a free night .

12/30 | December 30, 2009 | Wednesday

[Wednesday schedule]

  • Congratulate Mamoru for winning his meet and decide to get a job for his family ( Star Rank 9 ).
  • Aigis will return to the dorm. She asks Makoto to kill Ryoji to buy peace for S.E.E.S., but the team is determined to fight. Aigis’ resolution to fight with the team and find a new purpose evolves Palladion to Athena .
  • Claim all missing persons requests outside the police station. Visit the fortune teller, then go into Tartarus to rescue the missing people . Make sure to clear Harabah before leaving Tartarus.

12/31 | December 31, 2009 | Thursday

[Thursday schedule]

  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Ryoji will return today to hear the player’s answer . Players can choose to have the world succumb to The Fall and gain the Bad Ending, or fight Nyx on January 31 to decide the fate of the world .
  • If the player decides to fight, January will be unlocked . This encounter will also count as Ryoji’s last linked episode. The music box he gifts Makoto enables the fusion of Saturnus .
  • S.E.E.S. is determined to face Nyx despite impossible odds ( Fool Rank 10 ). Their determination unlocks Susano-o and gives rise to the Nyx Extermination Squad ( Judgment Rank 1 ).

1/1 | January 1, 2010 | Friday

[ Friday schedule ]
  • The entire morning will be spent on the Nyx Annhilation Team’s New Year shrine visit .
  • Elizabeth will call to inform the player about Tartarus’ new block and new requests.
  • Although not gameplay-relevant, the BGM for the dorm and town will change today.
  • Review your remaining quests. Completing every request is possible in one run .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/2| January 2, 2010 | Saturday

[ Saturday schedule ]
  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Watch a movie with Akihiko. This counts towards his hangout requirements for a new Characteristic.

1/3 | January 3, 2010 | Sunday

[ Sunday schedule ]
  • Tanaka’s Amazing Commodities goes full prepper/doomer mode, and so players cannot buy items from the shop from this point .
  • Have one last bowl of ramen with Mamoru and say your goodbyes at Iwatodai Station ( Star Rank 10 ). His father’s car key unlocks Helel , the light-bearer.
  • Tackle Tartarus. Try to reach the Genocidal Mercenary on floor 255 . Fuuka’s Tartarus Search skill will help speedrun to Monad Door and Gatekeeper levels. Gardening Soul Spinaches will help restore her SP while saving Chewing Souls and other SP items for big battles.
  • Every major floor conquered in Adamah will rank up the Judgement Arcana . Try to reach the last floor before January 31. By doing so, you can reach Judgement Rank 10 and unlock the ability to fuse Messiah .

1/4 | January 4, 2010 | Monday

[ Monday schedule ]
  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Talk about Akihiko’s future with Officer Kurosawa and see Akihiko’s resolve to protect his and his friends’ futures. This counts as Akihiko’s linked episode and his last one. Horus of the Sun Arcana unlocks upon receiving Akihiko’s Hand Wraps .

1/5 | January 5, 2010 | Tuesday

[ Tuesday schedule ]
  • Play shogi with Koromaru and feel his determination to protect Iwatodai, Makoto, and the world. This counts as Koromaru’s linked episode and his last one. Koromaru bequeaths his collar , unlocking Byakko , the last Persona required for fusing Kohryu.
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/6 | January 6, 2010 | Wednesday

[ Wednesday schedule ]
  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/7 | January 7, 2010 | Thursday

[ Thursday schedule ]
  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Go on a walk with Koromaru and Aigis. Aigis will hint that she wants to see the town with the player tomorrow .

1/8 | January 8, 2010 | Friday

[ Friday schedule ]
  • School resumes today . Start by answering The Underworld during Ms. Toriumi’s class.
  • Junpei and Yukari will meet up with the player on the rooftop. Makoto and his friends will affirm their decision to eliminate Nyx.
  • Aigis’s new human emotions have bloomed enough to begin the Aeon Social Link ( Aeon Rank 1 ). This action also unlocks the People Person achievement.
  • See if Yukari has improved her cooking. This counts towards her hangout requirement for her Characteristics.

1/9| January 9, 2010 | Saturday

[ Saturday schedule ]
  • Aigis expresses her desire to change and feel emotions ( Aeon Rank 2 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/10 | January 10, 2010 | Sunday

[ Sunday schedule ]
  • It's a free afternoon.
  • Tonight is a free night . If players go on a walk with Koromaru, they’ll bump into Keisuke.

1/11 | January 11, 2010 | Monday

[ Monday schedule ]
  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/12 | January 12, 2010 | Tuesday

[ Tuesday schedule ]
  • Ms. Ounishi’s lecture can either be nap time ( Courage ) or an opportunity to learn ( Academics ).
  • Wake up to Keisuke fretting over Makoto after a small accident ( Fortune Rank 8 ).
  • Have Akihiko pay off his bet from Yakushima and crush some ramen with Junpei, Aigis, and Yukari. Discover that Strega is behind the doomsday cult plaguing Iwatodai.
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/13 | January 13, 2010 | Wednesday

[ Wednesday schedule ]
  • Witness Hidetoshi’s change in attitude and receive his thanks for changing his perspective ( Emperor Rank 10 ). The cheap lighter Hidetoshi gives the player unlocks Odin , the ultimate form of the Emperor Arcana.
  • Go to Club Escapade. A suspicious-looking man will take you to “The Messiah.” Takaya will threaten the Nyx Extermination Squad and swear to fight them with Jun. This counts as Takaya’s linked episode, and the last one.

1/14 | January 14, 2010 | Thursday

[ Thursday schedule ]
  • See Keisuke’s attempt to run away stopped by multiple medical emergencies ( Fortune Rank 9 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/15| January 15, 2010 | Friday

[ Friday schedule ]
  • Elizabeth will inform players of two new missing persons in Tartarus .
  • Don’t adjust your screen: colors around Iwatodai will be more muted from this point onward.
  • Commiserate with Mr. Ono over the end of his favorite lecture ( Academics ) or take a nap ( Courage ).
  • Try to play ball with Junpei, end up talking about the past, and hear him thank Makoto for his leadership. This counts as Junpei’s linked episode and his last one. Surt , formerly the ultimate form of the Magician Arcana, unlocks with his Baseball Glove .
  • Let Yukari cook and gain the Characteristic Healing Apex , which reduces the SP cost of recovery skills to 25% of their normal SP cost .

1/16| January 16, 2010 | Saturday

[ Saturday schedule ]
  • Coach Aigis through explaining to Koromaru’s dog and cat friends why he’s been injured lately ( Aeon Rank 3 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/17 | January 17, 2010 | Sunday

[ Sunday schedule ]
  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/18 | January 18, 2010 | Monday

[ Monday schedule ]
  • Mr. Edogaawa’s pop quiz is answerable with Circe ( Charm ).
  • Help Aigis look for the old lady’s missing cat ( Aeon Rank 4 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/19 | January 19, 2010 | Tuesday

[ Tuesday schedule ]
  • Hear Keisuke promise to keep you alive on the surgery table so you can spend more time together ( Fortune Rank 10 ). His award letter unlocks Lakshmi , the ultimate form of the Fortune Arcana.
  • Lose to Ken with Koromaru, Akihiko, and Junpei watching because of Yukari. Receive Ken’s house key and his promise to stay connected. This counts as Ken’s linked episode and his last one. Ken’s Silver Key unlocks Michael of the Judgement Arcana .

1/20 | January 20, 2010 | Wednesday

[ Wednesday schedule ]
  • Witness Bebe zero-in on his kimono dreams and receive his thanks for your friendship ( Temperance Rank 9 ).
  • Rescue the missing persons tonight . Don’t forget to visit the Fortune Teller at Club Escapade beforehand to influence Tartarus.
  • Try to beat the Reaper for Elizabeth’s 100th request .
small
Related

Persona 3 Reload: How to Fight Elizabeth (Secret Boss)

In Persona 3 Reload, you'll be given the chance to take on Elizabeth in a battle. Follow this guide to beat the powerful boss with ease.
  • If you defeat the Reaper, you can challenge Elizabeth at the final Monad Door at the end of the top floor’s Monad Passage .
small
Related

Persona 3 Reload: How to Beat the Reaper

The Reaper has been a classic enemy since the first P3, and it's back again in Persona 3 Reload. Here's how to beat it.
  • Players who attempt to fight Elizabeth should thoroughly prepare before meeting her. Avoid challenging her tonight and set out to fight her before the 31st after preparing properly .
  • Players strictly following this guide are recommended to wait until January 30 to max out all Social Links and Linked Episodes . Doing so allows players to fuse Orpheus Telos , a Persona perfect for fighting Elizabeth.
    • Defeating Elizabeth is not mandatory .

1/21 | January 21, 2010 | Thursday

[ Thursday schedule ]
  • If players helped Chidori stay alive, she will wake up today . Chidori Yoshino has no memories of the last two years, but she and Junpei are determined to bring her memories back. This trip takes the entire afternoon .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/22| January 22, 2010 | Friday

[ Friday schedule ]
  • Andre Laurent Jean Geraux finishes his kimono today ( Temperance Rank 10 ). He gives Makoto a money pouch he sewed to prove he’ll come back. This unlocks Yurlunger .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/23| January 23, 2010 | Saturday

[ Saturday schedule ]
  • Finding the old lady’s cat and watching it reunite with the old lady makes Aigis cherish her friendships more ( Aeon Rank 5 ).
  • Watch Akihiko’s first official match with his commentary ( Courage up ) then receive an offer to box with him. This hangout unlocks the Characteristic Buff Amp , which greatly increases the effects of buffs on himself .

1/24 | January 24, 2010 | Sunday

[ Sunday schedule ]
  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/25 | January 25, 2010 | Monday

[ Monday schedule ]
  • Mrs. Terauchi announces her move to India. Stay up to hear her thank the class ( Academics ) or nod off ( Courage ).
  • Today is career consultation day with Ms. Toriumi. Kenji and Kaz tell Makoto Aigis is on the rooftop, where Aigis is contemplating her future.
  • This afternoon is free for any activity .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/26 | January 26, 2010 | Tuesday

[ Tuesday schedule ]
  • Stand back as Aigis discovers how shallow and self-centered high school kids can be ( Aeon Rank 6 ).
  • Read the final volume of the baseball manga with Junpei. Watch him self-actualize and unlock the Characteristic Critical Amp , which greatly raises his critical rate and critical hit strength .

1/27 | January 27, 2010 | Wednesday

[ Wednesday schedule ]
  • Watch Aigis comfort the old lady and herself then have an existential crisis ( Aeon Rank 7 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/28 | January 28, 2010 | Thursday

[ Thursday schedule ]
  • Ms. Toriumi holds the last Composition class for January. Either snooze through it ( Courage ) or pay attention ( Academics ).
  • Players can romance Aigis or keep her as their best friend ( Aeon Rank 8 ).
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/29| January 29, 2010 | Friday

[ Friday schedule ]
  • Make Aigis happy with some romance or by reassuring her that she’s your best friend ( Aeon Rank 9 ).
  • Go on a walk with the Nyx Extermination Squad and hang out at the shrine for one last light-hearted group fun before The Promised Day.

1/30| January 30, 2010 | Saturday

[ Saturday schedule ]
  • Preserve this moment with Aigis through a flip-phone selfie. Her earnest feelings ( Aeon Rank 10 ), vow to keep everyone’s memories alive, and charred screw unlocks Metatron .
  • If players followed this guide closely, they will have all Social Links maxed and unlock A Legacy of Friendships .
  • Tonight is a free night .

1/31 | January 31, 2010 | Sunday

[ Sunday schedule ]
  • Today is The Promised Day . Visit Paulownia Mall and Velvet Room to buy consumables and fuse Personas. Try to cover all magic and physical attacks , buffs , debuffs , diarahan/mediarahan , and ailment-causing and –curing spells .
  • Having Personas that cover all spell types will help with Strega and Nyx’s 14-part boss battle.
  • Nyx descends tonight .

Every choice made after this one is story-based. Congratulations, you’ve beaten Persona 3 Reload !

item.title: Lucky Red Dead Redemption 2 Player Gets Legendary Fish Without Doing Anything
item.description:
Highlights

  • Catching the legendary Sockeye Salmon in Red Dead Redemption 2 was easier than expected due to a bug in the game.
  • Some players have found shortcuts to catch this specific legendary fish, like using the swamp lure instead of the lake lure. However, the player did not need these, as it was simply beached on a nearby shore and readu for pickup.
  • Minor bugs like these can speed up hunting and fishing quests for players on repeat playthroughs of the game. However, those on their first runs may be disappointed, as it can rob them of special hunts.

One lucky player traveled half the map in Red Dead Redemption 2 in hopes of catching the legendary Sockeye Salmon at its only known fishing spot, only to be able to pick them up without needing to do any actual fishing. Considering that this specific fish is one of the hardest to catch in Red Dead Redemption 2 , some were likely jealous of the gamer.

In the world of Red Dead Redemption 2 , there are various activities to complete and side quests to experience. Some are stereotypical of the Wild West setting, such as the Red Dead Redemption 2 bounty quests, while others push players to see incredible scenery and meet interesting strangers. One such quest is the "Fisher of Fish", offered by Jeremy Gill, located on a short pier along the northeast shoreline of Flat Iron Lake. He gives players a map with the locations of thirteen legendary fish that can be caught after the players work out the exact locations of the fishing spots.

In a Reddit post, one Red Dead Redemption 2 player explains that they had embarked on a journey that took them across half the map to catch the Sockeye Salmon, found on Lake Isabella. The player expected the lengthy journey to culminate in using the best fishing techniques in Red Dead Redemption 2 to catch the legendary fish. Instead, they found it beached on the ice ready for pick-up.

Red Dead Redemption 2 Bug Makes it Easy to Catch the Sockeye Salmon

The underwhelming conclusion sparked other players who are fishing enthusiasts to pitch in with their own experiences of strange fishing incidents in Red Dead Redemption 2 . One such player explains that a bug still persists in the game which makes catching the Sockeye Salmon easier than it is normally. Instead of using the lake lure, which is the best lure for catching this legendary fish, they encourage players to use the swamp lure instead. According to this player, this bug makes it so that players can catch the legendary Sockeye Salmon straight away.

Five years after the game's release, some bugs like this still persist, and they are found in other quests. For instance, the legendary moose has been known to be shot by bounty hunters while players are hunting for it, while the legendary bison can be found dead on the prairie. Catching these animals fair and square is valuable content in the award-winning game that many first-time players may not want to skip. However, seeing as even catching goats in Red Dead Redemption 2 can take quite some time and extensive planning, players on their second or third playthrough could appreciate minor bugs like these to speed up the hunting and fishing quests.

item.title: Elden Ring: All Great Ghost Glovewort Locations In Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Difference Between Great Ghost Gloveworts & Great Grave Gloveworts
  • Location 1: Fog Rift Catacombs
  • Location 2: Scorpion River Catacombs
  • Location 3: Darklight Catacombs

Great Ghost Gloveworts are powerful upgrade materials in Elden Ring , allowing you to upgrade your favorite Renowned Spirit Ashes to their maximum level . If you're someone who relies on spirit summons to overcome challenging enemies, it's recommended that you prioritize collecting these rare flowers, as they are available only in limited numbers and cannot be purchased.

The base game includes four Great Ghost Gloveworts, and if you've already used them up, three more can be found in the DLC. This guide will help you find and collect all three Great Ghost Gloveworts in Shadow of the Erdtree so that you can max out your favorite elite Spirit Ashes.

Difference Between Great Ghost Gloveworts & Great Grave Gloveworts

Both Great Ghost and Grave Gloveworts are used to upgrade Spirit Ashes in Elden Ring. However, the key differences between both these Gloveworts are the following:

  • Great Grave Gloveworts are used to upgrade standard Spirit Ashes, while Great Ghost Gloveworts are for Renowned Spirit Ashes.
  • Great Ghost Gloveworts are comparatively more difficult to find than Great Grave Gloveworts. The latter are usually hidden in secret areas or behind bosses.

Location 1: Fog Rift Catacombs

The Fog Rift Catacombs is a relatively early location where you can find a Great Ghost Glovewort. The catacombs are located northwest of Castle Ensis, and you can reach the area by taking the northwest from the Castle Front Site of Grace . Once you reach the catacombs and discover the corresponding Site of Grace, follow the directions listed below:

  • Head north from the Fog Rift Catacombs Site of Grace, then turn west to discover a large chamber with a falling spike trap.
  • Activate the spike trap by approaching the chamber, then step back quickly to avoid damage. Once the trap rises back up, sprint west across the chamber and enter the arched passage.
  • Continue the dungeon's linear path until you reach a small room with a fireball-shooting Bigmouth Imp .
  • Turn west to find an incomplete staircase. Approach its end to activate another falling spike trap. When the trap descends, jump onto it, and sprint south to access another arched passage as the trap rises.
  • Follow the path to a small chamber guarded by three Messmer soldiers and a Black Knight. The Great Ghost Glovewort is inside the chamber.

Location 2: Scorpion River Catacombs

The second Great Ghost Glovewort can be found in the Scorpion River Catacombs, and you can reach this location while following the ravine north of the Temple Town Ruins . Once you make it to the catacombs, rest at the Site of Grace and prepare for exploration.

Make sure to carry some Rejuvenating Boluses to alleviate the Death Blight status build-up.

  • From the Site of Grace, head southeast. At the end of the passage, turn northeast to enter a large chamber where a statue will inflict the Death Blight status if you get into its line of sight .
  • Sprint northeast to avoid the statue's gaze and enter another passage.
  • Continue southeast until you reach an area with a Bigmouth Imp. Evade it and head southeast into a passageway, then turn southwest.
  • Enter a large area with falling spike traps. Activate a trap and, when it rises, sprint across the room and under the overhead walkway.
  • Stick to the west wall and circle around it to find a ladder leading up the walkway.
  • Sprint southeast across the walkway, consuming Rejuvenating Boluses to avoid Death Blight status buildup. The walkway leads to an elevator.
  • Take the elevator down. Exit and head southwest, avoiding the Death Blight eyes patrolling the passage.
  • The passage opens to an area guarded by Bigmouth Imps. Defeat them and continue southeast to enter another open area with two imps and a mage on a platform.
  • Find the ladder at the northeastern end of the room, below the mage. Descend to collect the second Great Ghost Glovewort.

Location 3: Darklight Catacombs

The final Great Ghost Glovewort is located in the Darklight Catacombs, which requires you to have progressed through the Shadow Keep and discovered the teleportation coffin. The coffin takes you to the Ruins of Unte, from where you must ride southeast to reach the catacombs . Once you discover the Darklight Catacombs Site of Grace, prepare to find the third Great Ghost Glovewort:

  • From the Site of Grace, follow the linear path north to reach an elevator that takes you down into the dungeon.
  • Exit the elevator and head northeast to find a short set of stairs leading to a balcony with an imp.
  • From the balcony, go west and down the stairs to reach an elevated platform.
  • Drop from the platform and head in the general eastern direction. Make your way past the mages and imps to find another elevator that takes you further down into the dungeon.
  • Exit the elevator and head east to encounter a giant Bigmouth Imp on a pedestal . Approach the pedestal while evading the imp's fireballs.
  • Once near the pedestal, head north to find a lever that lowers the pedestal, bringing the Bigmouth Imp to ground level.
  • Defeat the giant Bigmouth Imp to obtain the final Great Ghost Glovewort.
